column4: yo, i just added a samba share, do i have to manually set up a username and password to access it from another computer?
zcat[1] : yeah, its a wireless network which i think my neighbours have accidentally used
do i just want smbpassword -a [my local username] ?
it doesnt bother me, but why doesnt ubuntu if not give you a gui way of doing it, at least tell you something still has to be done?
nah, its like that song, "i filed a bug and the bug won"
well the problem will continue to exist :(
could be fixed for gutsy though???: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SimpleSambaIntegrationSpec
would be nice. see my blueprint here on the bigger problem :) https://blueprints.launchpad.net/launchpad/+spec/launchpad-voting-system

the even bigger problem here is that people don't file bugs. i'm sure they would if they already had a launchpad account, but they just don't sign up. i imagine even LESS people would sign up for the voting
having a voting system would give people an incentive to file bugs and get things they want passed
for instance, id vote for your samba bug. not long ago i had to LAN with a bunch of windows users and when i couldnt get a samba share working easy, they all bagged me out
aahhh, hurt pride. the great motivation for technological improvement
